result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 21CM737, 22CF105, 22CF203 are called at 9:20 AM) Defendant Maxwell F Oatman in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Maxwell F Oatman. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense filed motion to modify bond. No objection by State. 
Court orders the No contact with J.B. or H.O. be dropped. Defendant to sign a new bond. 
Status Conference: 08/17/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 09:25 am.

9:11 AM cases 22CF203, 21CM737, 22CF105 called. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maxwell F Oatman in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Maxwell F Oatman. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense asks for more time for resolution. 
A status conference (possible plea) is scheduled for 6/27/22 at 9:25 AM.
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.

2:15 PM cases 21CM737 22CF105 and 22CF203 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maxwell F Oatman in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Maxwell F Oatman. 
In 22CF203: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
In 22CF105: Continued bond modification request. Defense advises J.B. and H.O. requested the no contacts be lifted. Defense also requests a lowered cash bond. State does not object to electronic and telephonic communication with the victims. Court modifies bond to a $600 cash bond with new conditions. 
All files scheduled for a status conference 6/8/22 at 9:15 AM.

Cases called at 8:48 AM: 21CM737, 22CF105, 22CF203.
Defendant Maxwell F Oatman in custody, in court with Attorney Karl A Schmidt.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF105: Defense requests the bond be amended to remove the no contacts with J.B. and H.O. and lower the bond to $1,000 Cash. 
State objects as there are no new factors and the proper procedure to lift a no contact has not been followed. 
Court denies the motion to modify the bond at this time. Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing in 22CF203.
STC: 4/13/22 at 2:15 PM.
Status conference on April 8, 2022 at 08:45 am.

(9:18 AM cases 21CM737, 22CF105, 22CF203 called.) Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Maxwell F Oatman appeared in court, in custody. Attorney Karl A Schmidt for Maxwell F Oatman appeared in court.
Defendant waives reading of Information in case 22CF105 and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts in all cases, which the Court accepts.
Status Conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 8:45 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with A.A., N.A., D.A., or their residence, 1230 or 1232 S Dewey St addresses
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:04 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Maxwell F Oatman appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Maxwell F Oatman.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Attorney Cook and the State note the defendant has pending cases scheduled for court on March 11, 2022 at 9 am in Branch 4.
Court orders this case will track with the defendant's other cases.
Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 9 am in Branch 4.

Conditions:
No contact with A.A., N.A., D.A., or their residence, 1230 or 1232 S Dewey St addresses
